comment: She grades lab reports super heavy. She gives guidance during labs but very little on the actual lab reports most of the class was confused for a very long time. Very strict with how your notebook should be and the lab report. Was a little hard and stressful taking this lab but eventually she started getting easier towards the end.

Good lab professor but bad at teaching concepts. Understandable since u should know the information prior, but she is patient n will go over the concepts. However, she hates repeating the procedures n would tell u to just read the lab manual. Requires a lot of preparation for the class but it's the same for all chem labs.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: I've actually had her for CHEM2800L and CHEM1211L also and in all three classes she was a tough grader. She's very helpful in her office hours though. If you actually want to understand chemistry and become a good chemist, take her. If you want an easy professor, look somewhere else.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: Her lectures are mostly concepts, with very few actual examples. She then expects you to be able to solve problems when you have not been shown the actual methods for solving. Her tests are very difficult and there are no resources to help prepare you for them. Read the textbook! I only like her because she rounded my class grade from a B to an A.

2800L was a HARD lab. She grades very strictly, but you will come out of it a better chemist, hands down. She rounded my 89.4 to an A at the end. The upside is that she will absolutely help you with the reports in her office hours and basically check your work/help you ensure you're on the right track. You can get an A if you ask for help.

Dr. Zhou is impossible to dislike--she's really sweet and understanding. However, 2800 is a very hard course. I averaged B's on my exams and I was reading the textbook. Her lectures are mostly examples and practice and not much conceptual teaching, so you almost HAVE to read the book. You don't really have a choice if you're chem/biochem though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: She is the only one who teaches this lab and she grades EXTREMELY hard. She is an amazing person in lecture but I just did not like her lab.

I loved her in the lecture, she was absolutely amazing. Granted, she is the only one that teaches this class but it was just CHEM 1211 and 1212 combined. The tests are essentially the study guides and she has at least one bonus on each of her tests. There is A LOT of homework though.

I only took this professor because she was the only one, but she's not a very good lecturer at all and her tests are different than the practice tests that she says to study. I'm also taking Organic Chemistry and that is 10 times easier than 2800 just because she makes this class unnecessarily difficult. Don't take her if you have other options.

I had her 1211 lab. She goes over the concept needed for the lab briefly at the beginning of class for those students who haven't had their lecture class yet. She also has an accent (not very strong) and some students make fun of her for that and I feel bad. She's not strict on notebook checks but is strict on grading the lab reports.

She is a good person but her teaching skills are not the greatest. She doesn't go over the more complex subjects in lectures. Her tests are challenging and only get more difficult throughout the semester. I would recommend another professor but she is the only one that teaches this. She told my class that tutors won't help in this class.

Overall the class wasnt bad. She gave us a lot of work for an online class but for a subject like chem its worth it because it helps your grade. Quizzes and Tests required Lockdown Browser and Webcam. The class itself was dreadful but Dr. Zhou was a good teacher. Sometimes I did have a tough time understanding her but thats what YouTube is for.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: She isn't the worst professor but definitely not the best. A LOT of online homework which can take numerous hours to complete. Do not think about missing class, or you will never catch back up. She lectures very fast and with no thorough explanations. I learned most of the material through YouTube.

Dr. Zhou knows what she is talking about and is very kind. Missing a day will put you VERY behind! The amount of homework is the problem. I am a chemistry major and I love the material, however, her assignments take up to 8 hours/week and are not due on Sunday nights. I think this is very inconsiderate because students have jobs + other classes.

Dr. Zhou is an amazing professor, she is extremely kind and cares about her student's success in her classes. I've had her a few times, and the material is difficult to learn (especially in her analytical classes), but once you get the flow of studying the text it becomes easier. Overall I highly recommend her as a professor.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Mrs. Zhou has a slight accent but is not hard to understand. She has amazing lectures, if you attend them and do the homework you will pass. She goes over some HW as example problems so it helps in class and to do HW. But there is a lot of HW. There are 4 tests, 4 quizzes, HW, and the ACS final for your overall grade. She gives extra credit
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof Zhou is very sweet and wants you to pass. If you ask her questions she'll give them to you. There's quite a bit of homework but it will actually help you learn. Tests are hard so study and go to study sessions. Worst thing about the class is that there's a standardized test, but she will make sure you're prepared.

Overall, I think this professor is good compared to the other science professors. The course itself is difficult, so be ready for work for your grade. I like how she actually answer your questions especially during office hours. She has multiple extra credit opportunities. Also, attendance is important for this class.

I took Dr. Zhou online since she switched our class format to accommodate popular vote. The homework and pre-test(s) were tedious, but SUPER helpful! She graded attendance, and was almost always behind in lecture compared to homework; so you may have to study ahead to keep up with the course progression.

The course content is hard, but Zhou is not. She will accommodate lectures for how students want to handle class time, and she will let you retake practice tests that are 20% of your grade. She does a lot for her students to help them learn, but the content is difficult. Be prepared to work hard, but you'll love her kindness.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class is the hardest class Ive taken. The professor doesnt teach you anything and youll spend the entire semester teaching yourself. These were 8 test, homework and discussions due every week, and must pass practice exams before taking actual exam. She is available 1 every two weeks and talks fast during lectures, assuming you know everythn
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Made this class harder than it needed to be. Take with a different professor.

Zhou is a very nice person, but not a good teacher. She expected us to watch and understand upwards 45-60 minutes of lecture (for a flipped classroom), and then made attendance mandatory. She used the entire class period to solve/vaguely explain homework questions, and I felt like I got a surprise with every practice/unit test. Avoid at all costs.

She gave a test every other week but everything was extremely straight forward with her and there were no surprises. She was very understanding during COVID and taught us accordingly. She made it very clear what would be on the test and she even gave us practice tests. I put in minimal effort (really only studied once a week) and passed. Take her

She is very nice and caring. The lectures weren't the best, but if you have the textbook and read and do the practice problems you will fine. There were 8 exams. This is a tough class, but if you put in the work you can make a B easily. If you would like an A you must be prepared to spend a lot of time working for it.

She is pretty nice honestly but I find it very difficult to learn from her. I realized part through the course, if you just study her slides and understand the material, then you'll do fine on the tests. Used the book a lot to supplement information and help understand lecture. Her lab is also pretty easy but she had strict criteria.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Zhou is very caring and she is very textbook heavy in her teaching style. Tests are pretty hard, but if you listen and take notes on her lectures, you should be able to do well. However, her lectures are not very helpful at all for conceptual understanding--just helpful for passing tests.
I personally could not understand her. I dont think she  was a horrible professor, but I just felt like I could not go to help for her

Dr. Zhou is very kind and accessible. Sometimes her lectures are difficult to follow but she always wants to help. I relied on the textbook and mastering hw to learn and I did very well. Only grades are 4 tests and average of all hw grades. Attendance is not mandatory but encouraged. If you're not a science/math orientated person don't take.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: This is a hard class in it's nature. Prof Zhou gives you so much options as for extra work and extra study time to pass this class, yes she has a thick accent. But this is chemistry and I will give her points for trying very hard to make it easier for her students. I took the lecture and I would say out of all the science profs at KSU she's my fav
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Super hard accent. I had her for Chem lab and she is not very good. Doesn't explain things well and she makes you check with her before you leave and is not clear about anything you need to fix in your notebook, but won't let you leave until you have it right.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She isn't a great teacher. Doesn't take time out of the class to answer questions and is too focused on getting through the lesson each day. She is difficult to understand and relies too much on the textbook rather than the actual content she is teaching.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: this lab was very intensive and you will learn A LOT of skills. the lab reports take a long time but as long as you follow the rubric you'll get a good great. there is a lot of pre-lab work to do but it is not that hard just very time consuming!!!!she's accessible during office hours so be sure to ask her questions.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--SO MANY PAPERS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Textbook heavy! Her powerpoints are just pictures from the textbook. she doesn't have time to answer questions in class, she refers you to her office hours. She is super nice, but her lectures aren't helpful at all. BE prepared to teach yourself with her.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Zhou will be your best chemistry tutor. She offers to help during labs and basically gives you thee answers. She is not picky on grading labs. Take her.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is extreemely caring and wants you to do well. Fantastic lab teacher. Slight accent, but easy grader. Take her and you will get an A as long as you don't miss and labs.

She tries, but she's not a great teacher, & not very helpful. Her lectures don't make very much sense, there are quizzes once a week, and four tests. If you do take her, be prepared to teach yourself by doing the HW. That was enough for me (I didn't even have the textbook), but I tend to be pretty good at chem, and a lot of people really struggled.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Take Koether for quant instead!! Koether is SO much easier than Zhou. I withdrew from Zhou's lecture because she was so bad, and retook it with Koether, and what a world of difference! I couldn't understand a word of what Zhou was saying,and her tests were HARD. Avoid her!!!
She's great and I hate chemistry. She drops many tests with the ACS final and give a good amount of extra credit. Really nice and caring and wants you to pass.

Make sure you're paying attention during lectures, her accent can be hard to understand. USE THE STUDY GUIDES GIVEN OUT AT THE SI SESSIONS. They mirror the format of her tests! She is very nice and has a fair grading system.

Her accent can be hard to understand sometimes. She is nice, but sometimes the language barrier is problem when she cannot explain concepts clearly. For me, I do well from studying hard before tests rather than her teaching well. I still like her but I would change professors if i Could,.

SHE IS ADORABLE.. She has a thick accent and is difficult to follow if you are not paying attention, but she tries very hard.  She is very helpful if you have questions, but you have to make sure she understands what you are asking. Her grading policy is more then fair and she makes jokes and it's cute because of her accent.

I took her Analytical Chemistry and Instrumental Analysis courses. Some chapters are difficult to understand so make sure that you come to her office hours. She is very helpful. The lab experiments are interesting. I would love to take her again.
She's nice and willing to help, subject matter is ok.
Difficult accent to understand but she really tries to make herself understandable. Tests are fairly easy if you do the Sapling assignments.

Her accent is very thick, but she enunciates enough so that you can understand her.  Her tests are usually harder than recitation material, so don't study to know the right answer; study to understand. For test 2, don't just know how to do the questions, but be able to do them quickly.  I understood everything but got an 80 because I didn't finish!
She is a nice Prof who is always ready for help you.  Even though her class is challenging, she offer a lot of EXTRA CREDIT. There for, it is not hard to get a A in her class. I highly recommend her.

A good listener to the students and clearly set expectation on what to be covered and the details for the all semester. Her exams and practice materials are so useful and we as student should stop blaming professors for not doing our part in extra studies and practice.Its science and not an art class. Recommend her for her quality work.
Only Proffessor I had that was well organized and was willing to help/work with students!

She is very clear about the difficulty level of the exams, so study up for that second exam.  You can tell she does not speak english as her first language, but she speaks slower and that helps for the material sometimes. She gave lots of extra credit, and the recitation helps with extra points.

Dr.Zhou is a great teacher. She very clearly spells out her expectations and gives students plenty of practice material and extra credit. She gives plenty of help during office hours, and recitation. Her tests are challenging but fair. She expects students to be able to do basic algebra. Read the chapters before class to get the most out of lecture

Don't let the bad reviews scare you. Tests are EASY (if YOU actually do the study guide). If you go to recitation it is an auto 10 points on the test. If you don't, max test grade is a 90%. 5-10 E.C. points per test. Has an accent, but not too bad. Atom is "item", photon is "fountain" etc...Oh, and for Christ's sake read the book, you're in college

I have had Dr. Zhou for several classes and have not had any problems with her whatsoever. The language barrier is minimal if you actually pay attention, and she is really helpful outside of class also. I don't know why so many people have such a bad attitude towards her. Chemistry is a hard subject, take Biology if it's too hard for you!
ok teacher. powerpoints are very helpful and she is willing to work with you until you understand.

Doctor Zhou may be intelligent, but her helpfulness is nonexistent. She has the habit of telling you to do one thing and then demanding that you do the opposite. Additionally, when asked for help, if you do not understand instantly she becomes angry, even when her explanation is not clear at all.

She's not half as bad as people say. If have an ear for accents and pay attention, her lectures are pretty good. As for the work, you do need to learn subject, but then that's what classes are for. As for her appearance, she's young, thin, female and dresses well. Those things alone might make her about the hottest professor at SPSU.

Attendance isn't required but she gives quizzes just because attendance is low. Can't understand anything she says and doesn't explain concepts clearly in lecture or recitation. Teaching style is not up to par with the college level. Her grading is something horrid. If you want to fail CHEM she's your lady!!!

Lectures are not understandable, since they are all taught by 90 slide powerpoints for each chapter. Professor Zhou also has difficulty answering questions that students have due to the language barrier. Her only  plus is that she is very prompt with grading exams.

not as bad as everyone says. has a bad engrish accent, when she says "also" it comes out as "oh-so" i thought it was funny. she puts the slides online when she says she will, and gives practice tests, so she is fairly easy.
she is pretty good... at least her tests are easy..and she gave us sample tests every time before exams...so i think she will be helpful if u guys going to take her class...

Had her for Chem II lab... impossible to learn a thing.  Her grading system is incomprehensible, along with her speech. Appears to get flustered easily, especially when helping a student who doesn't instantly "get it." There are better instructors, avoid her if possible.

I got an A in her class but had to do all the work myself.  She is impossible to understand and doesn't mind calling you out.  If you ask her for help she'll make you feel really stupid.  Avoid taking her at all costs.
